notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: Snorre Sturlasson, Norges Monge-Sagaer eller Heimskringla (The Sagas of Morway's Kings or Heimskringla) (Chicago: Skandinaven, 1901). This book was translated from the Icelandic by Professor P. A. Munchs and S. Ryghs. It contains twenty full-page, half-tone illustrations.

The book begins with the legend: "Thor's Battle with the Goblins," including a part of the interesting viking period up to and including Haakon Haakonsson and Helge Hvase. It also contains a short biography of the author, Snorre Sturlasson, written by Professor Munchs.
